column1: '''''Bored of the Rings''''' is a 1985 video game published for several platforms,  influenced by the novel [[Bored of the Rings (book)
column2: of the same name]]. It is the first of the series ''[[Hairy Toes]]'',<ref name="El Anillo">[http://www.meristation.com/v3/des_articulo.php?pic=CON&id=2254&idj=&idp=&tipo=art&c=1&pos=4 Meristation, El Anillo Interactivo] p. 5 (retrieved 21 September 2010)</ref> the other part is ''[[The Boggit]]''.<ref name="El Anillo"/> It was written with The Quill.<ref name="Spectrum">[http://www.worldofspectrum.org/infoseekid.cgi?id=0006036 Bored of the Rings] at [[Wikipedia:World of Spectrum

column1: Unlike the book, character names are more reminiscent of the original work. ''Grandalf'' is [[Gandalf]], ''Bimbo'' is [[Bilbo Baggins]] and ''Fordo'' is [[Frodo Baggins]], among others. The game is divided into four parts; unlocking a new part requires a password received at the end of the previous part.<ref name="Tolkien Games">[http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/bored.html Bored of the Rings] at Tolkien Games (retrieved 21 September 2010)</ref> The game is only playable in a single player mode.<ref name="Spectrum"/> The authors of the game are [[Fergus McNeill]],<ref name="Spectrum"/><ref name="Tolkien Games"/> [[Judith Child]]<ref name="Tolkien Games"/> and [[Ian Willis]].<ref name="Tolkien Games"/>
